body:
For escapes where we are not certain if we should implement them or not, it would be helpful to have a column in the escape sequence table to document if a maintainer is for or against adding an escape. That should make it pretty simple to rule out escapes quickly without requiring too much discussion about every single one.

If there are some disagreements, discussion can then start based off of that list, but to rule out some basic escapes that are not needed it would likely be a very helpful system.

Seems like there's pretty good reason to implement [`OSC 4`](https://invisible-island.net/xterm/ctlseqs/ctlseqs.html#h3-Operating-System-Commands) at least. This will most likely superseded #1771 since that issue is specific to X11, and this escape is more generic. A separate tool could easily then read Xresources and send the appropriate escapes.

I've started the list [here](https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/wiki/ANSI-References#csi-control-sequence-introducer---esc-). I'm not 100% sure how the voting should really work TBH, but we can add the existing stuff in there, and start with some obvious missing escapes.

issue.title: Adding use_xrdb to config and support for xrdb on colors
issue.body:
Fixes #1771 **Load colors from Xresources.**

## Proposed Changes
  - **alacritty.yml**: Adds a new config option on colors: `use_xrdb: bool`
  - **alacritty_terminal/Cargo.toml**: Adds the external (and very new) crate [xrdb](https://crates.io/crates/xrdb) 
  - **alacritty_terminal/src/config/colors.rs**: Adds new field for deserialize `use_xrdb`
  - **alacritty_terminal/src/term/color.rs**: Adds a new private function
    `xrdb_colors -> bool` that will check for the `use_xrdb` option and try to
    load colors using the xrdb lib. If any of the previous is false or fails, it
    returns false, which leads to previus normal flow on fill_named. Otherwise
    it adds the expected xrdb to NamedColor.

## New dependencies?
Yes, [xrdb](https://crates.io/crates/xrdb).

### Warning:
- I am still starting to learn Rust
- This is my first serious PR ever ;)

body:
I've decided to move it to a separate page, since the escape sequence reference is mostly unrelated to Alacritty's support for them. It can now be found under https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/wiki/Escape-Sequence-Support.

I think for voting it might be good to just have the name of the voter with a red/yellow/green symbol besides it.

The only major change I've made to your proposal is that I've removed the `Justification` field, since different people might have different justifications and it doesn't seem super maintainable to add a thousand different links to various issue comments.

Instead, I've added a `tracking issue` column. If someone is interested in outlining their ideas, a tracking issue should be created for the escape with their reasoning about it. I think that would make things a lot easier since it forces us to keep all the discussion in one place.

Also just to make sure this issue can be closed at some point, I'd like to have a very clear definition of when it is completed.

I don't think it's reasonable to expect every single escape to be documented with a decision, so I'd say once all escape sequences are documented that Alacritty currently supports, this issue should be done. I think that's a fair minimum of what Alacritty should document.
